function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Underdeveloped Integrated Vector Management (IVM) due to funding challenges, inter-sectoral cooperation, effective policy frameworks, and disciplinary divides.","Impact":"Ineffective control of vectors and pests, leading to increased risk of vector-borne diseases (VBD) transmission.","Mitigation":"Increase funding, improve inter-sectoral cooperation, develop effective policy frameworks, and bridge disciplinary divides to strengthen IVM.","Technologies":"Improved surveillance and monitoring technologies, advanced vector control methods, and community-based interventions.","People":"Communities at risk of vector-borne diseases, government departments, NGOs, and research institutes.","Owner":"Government, NGOs, research institutes, and community-based groups."},{"Description":"Lack of large-scale trials for integrated vector control approach for diseases like malaria, leishmaniasis, lymphatic filariasis, and dengue.","Impact":"Limited evidence-based approach for vector control effectiveness in addressing VBD scenarios.","Mitigation":"Conduct large-scale trials to evaluate the effectiveness of integrated vector control for key vector-borne diseases.","Technologies":"Advanced surveillance and monitoring technologies, vector control methods, and community-based interventions.","People":"Communities at risk of VBD, research institutes, and government departments.","Owner":"Research institutes, government departments, and community-based groups."},{"Description":"Narrow focus in disease elimination programs neglecting common vectors transmitting multiple diseases in the same communities (e.g., Global Programme to Eliminate Lymphatic Filariasis).","Impact":"Incomplete approach to vector control, disregarding the co-transmission of diseases by common vectors.","Mitigation":"Expand the focus of disease elimination programs to consider common vectors transmitting multiple diseases in the same communities.","Technologies":"Advanced surveillance and monitoring technologies, vector control methods, and community-based interventions.","People":"Communities at risk of VBD, government departments, and disease elimination program stakeholders.","Owner":"Government departments, research institutes, and community-based groups."}]}
